intro: Drosanthemum strictifolium, commonly known as the rigid-leaf drosanthemum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in dense, fleshy leaves that are typically green or bluish-gray in color. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, often in shades of yellow or orange. It is well adapted to arid environments and requires minimal water once established.
